<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Big Debut](/Feats.aspx?ID=4146) <actions string="Free Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Firebrands](/Sources.aspx?ID=196) pg. 80</row>

**Archetypes** [Celebrity](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=54), [Gladiator](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=61) (Level 10)

**Frequency**
once per day

**Prerequisites**
[Celebrity Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1931); [Gladiator Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1976)

**Access**
Members of the Firebrands at the rank of second mark or higher have access to this feat.

**Trigger**
You're about to roll initiative.

</column>

---

Now's your chance! You're a Firebrand, and the world must know it. You strike a dramatic pose, deliver a snappy quip, or reveal a shocking new costume, captivating everyone who can see you. You don't roll initiative. Instead, you voluntarily go last. Enemies who can see you must attempt a Will saving throw against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a failure, the enemy is overcome with anticipation for what you'll do next on the battlefield and becomes [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) (stunned 2 on a critical failure). As your first action on your first turn, you can Interact to draw or stow an item of light Bulk as a free action; if this item is a small garment or accessory, such as a fan, a pair of gloves, or a wine glass, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus on Charisma-based skill checks until the end of your turn.
